title: How to set up a promotion button for the till layout
text: A Question to bear in mind when creating any new promotions Q) - I’ve set up a promotion code “WATLODGEDIS” to give 20% off certain tickets. When I go to the button configuration on the till and try to create the promotion button. In the drop down “promotion scheme” dropdown there are no promotions listed. Can you advise how I associate a scheme with a button? A) - Promotion set to everyone, changed to selected and now can add to a button. There are no products added to this promotion at the moment so this needs to be done before it can be active.
description:
A Question to bear in mind when creating any new promotions


Q) - I’ve set up a promotion code “WATLODGEDIS” to give 20% off certain tickets. When I go to the button configuration on the till and try to create the promotion button. In the drop down “promotion scheme” dropdown there are no promotions listed. Can you advise how I associate a scheme with a button?


A) - Promotion set to everyone, changed to selected and now can add to a button. There are no products added to this promotion at the moment so this needs to be done before it can be active.

title: Is there a limit to the number of characters that can be used in a PLU?
text: Q) - Is there a limit to the number of characters that can be used in a PLU? A) - Yes: Short Description – 50 Characters Long Description – 255 Characters
description:
Q) - Is there a limit to the number of characters that can be used in a PLU?  


A) - Yes:

Short Description – 50 Characters

Long Description – 255 Characters

title: No recent updates warning
text: Q) - when I sign in onto the till in the morning it comes up with a warning to say that there have been no recent updates? A) - This just means that till data has not been recreated in this amount of time, if no changes have been made in the back office then this doesn’t matter. If changes have been made in the back office then all the customer needs to do is recreate till data.
description:
Q) - when I sign in onto the till in the morning it comes up with a warning to say that there have been no recent updates?


A) - This just means that till data has not been recreated in this amount of time, if no changes have been made in the back office then this doesn’t matter. If changes have been made in the back office then all the customer needs to do is recreate till data.

title: The installer on a new setup recommended opening services? This will be where to find MeracUpdater how do I navigate to this ?
text: Q) - the installer on a new setup recommended opening services? This will be where to find PDBMeracUpdater how do I navigate to this ? A) - If you press the Windows Start Button/Windows Key on your keyboard, type ‘services’ into the Windows search bar, The built in Windows Services app will appear in this list (Below Left). Click on this. This will open the Services window (Above Right). Look for the MeracUpdater service in the list, and click Restart the service. Again, If you do not have this option, you will need to be an administrator. Best trying to restart your PC which will also work.
description:
Q) - the installer on a new setup recommended opening services? This will be where to find PDBMeracUpdater how do I navigate to this ?


A) - If you press the Windows Start Button/Windows Key on your keyboard, type ‘services’ into the Windows search bar, The built in Windows Services app will appear in this list (Below Left). Click on this.

This will open the Services window (Above Right). Look for the MeracUpdater service in the list, and click Restart the service. Again, If you do not have this option, you will need to be an administrator. Best trying to restart your PC which will also work.

title: Why can I not recreate the till data for my back office pseudo till
text: Q) - Why can I not recreate the till data for my back office pseudo till ? A) - Pseudo tills are virtual tills. You cannot recreate till data for virtual till. The settings circled below that you have defined for this till is how you would configure a pseudo till. If you want to setup the till as an actual real physical till, “Type of Till” needs to be set to MStore EPOS Till and there is no need to define a Default (PLU) as a real till does not even use this setting. Then you will be able to recreate till data for the till in back office.
description:
Q) - Why can I not recreate the till data for my back office pseudo till ?


A) - Pseudo tills are virtual tills. You cannot recreate till data for virtual till. The settings circled below that you have defined for this till is how you would configure a pseudo till. If you want to setup the till as an actual real physical till, “Type of Till” needs to be set to MStore EPOS Till and there is no need to define a Default (PLU) as a real till does not even use this setting. Then you will be able to recreate till data for the till in back office.

title: Why are my PLU’s not showing up on the tills when scanned, coming up with the error “Item not found”
text: Q) - Why are my PLU’s not showing up on the tills when scanned, coming up with the error “Item not found” ? A) - The reason for this most of the times is when Items are added correctly to the database via the back office, The user must always recreate till data and update the tills in order for these items to start showing up when scanned.
description:
Q) - Why are my PLU’s not showing up on the tills when scanned, coming up with the error “Item not found” ?


A) - The reason for this most of the times is when Items are added correctly to the database via the back office, The user must always recreate till data and update the tills in order for these items to start showing up when scanned.

title: How to setup a Free item when another item is bought
text: This explains how to create a promotion where an item is free when bought with another. In this example a free book is given when a season ticket is bought. Open Promotion wizard and select basket. Next. Enter the description and code Add the items to be discounted. Next. Select the item they need to purchase to receive the promotion. Complete the dates and times you would like the promotion to be active. Open Promotions and select the promotion just created. Enter the number to be purchased to fire the promotion.
description:
This explains how to create a promotion where an item is free when bought with another. In this example a free book is given when a season ticket is bought. 

Open Promotion wizard and select basket. Next. 


 

  

  

Enter the description and code 

  

 

  

Add the items to be discounted. Next. 

  

 

  

  

Select the item they need to purchase to receive the promotion. 

  

 

  


Complete the dates and times you would like the promotion to be active.

  


Open Promotions and select the promotion just created. 

Enter the number to be purchased to fire the promotion.

title: Instructions On Installing Gift Aid Manager To Send To Customers
text: Below are instructions on installing the Gift Aid Manager for customers. You may need to re-add the Gift Aid Manager link for customers to be able to access. Speak to Harry Willatts if you need to the files, and cannot get it via the link in the instructions. To install the Merac Gift Aid Manager, please follow the below instructions: Download Merac Gift Aid Manager from this OneDrive link (This is only valid for three days so please save this somewhere if you need to install on other PC’s): https://www.dropbox.com/scl/fo/yhsf3sx3880ciyjj84vld/h?rlkey=pou7miqj264bwa3ecu1185ux5&dl=0 Extract this folder and run setup.exe. Navigate to “C:\Program Files (x86)\Merac\Gift Aid” folder. Rename MeracGiftAid.exe to “MeracGiftAidOLD.exe” within this folder. Return back to the Merac Gift Aid Manager folder downloaded and copy “MeracGiftAid.exe”. Paste this MeracGiftAid.exe to the “C:\Program Files (x86)\Merac\Gift Aid” folder. You should then be able to access the Gift Aid Manager through the Merac Back Office in Setup if you have the permissions set for your user. Any further issues, let me know.
description:
Below are instructions on installing the Gift Aid Manager for customers. You may need to re-add the Gift Aid Manager link for customers to be able to access. Speak to Harry Willatts if you need to the files, and cannot get it via the link in the instructions. 

  

To install the Merac Gift Aid Manager, please follow the below instructions: 

  • Download Merac Gift Aid Manager from this OneDrive link (This is only valid for three days so please save this somewhere if you need to install on other PC’s):  
  • https://www.dropbox.com/scl/fo/yhsf3sx3880ciyjj84vld/h?rlkey=pou7miqj264bwa3ecu1185ux5&dl=0 
  • Extract this folder and run setup.exe. 
  • Navigate to “C:\Program Files (x86)\Merac\Gift Aid” folder. 
  • Rename MeracGiftAid.exe to “MeracGiftAidOLD.exe” within this folder. 
  • Return back to the Merac Gift Aid Manager folder downloaded and copy “MeracGiftAid.exe”. 
  • Paste this MeracGiftAid.exe to the “C:\Program Files (x86)\Merac\Gift Aid” folder. 

You should then be able to access the Gift Aid Manager through the Merac Back Office in Setup if you have the permissions set for your user. Any further issues, let me know.

title: Recalculate Stock Movement Figures
text: TABLE OF CONTENTS Fix Movements For One Item Fix Movements for All Items Fix Movements For One Item If you notice the stock movement calculations for one of your stock items is incorrect, you can click View in the top-right of the stock's Stock Maintenance screen, then press Movements. Then, within the Stock Movements window, click Edit in the top-left of the Stock Movements screen. Finally click Fix Movements to recalculate these movements for that one item. Fix Movements for All Items If you would like to run this for all of your stock items in your system; you can click Edit in the top-left of the Stock Take screen. Then click Fix Stocktake to recalculate stock movements for all items since the last stock take. This will take a considerable amount of time, so don't be alarmed if this takes 5-10 minutes and shows as though the screen is not responding.
description:
TABLE OF CONTENTS

  • Fix Movements For One Item
  • Fix Movements for All Items

Fix Movements For One Item

If you notice the stock movement calculations for one of your stock items is incorrect, you can click View in the top-right of the stock's Stock Maintenance screen, then press Movements. 


Then, within the Stock Movements window, click Edit in the top-left of the Stock Movements screen. Finally click Fix Movements to recalculate these movements for that one item.


Fix Movements for All Items

If you would like to run this for all of your stock items in your system; you can click Edit in the top-left of the Stock Take screen. Then click Fix Stocktake to recalculate stock movements for all items since the last stock take. This will take a considerable amount of time, so don't be alarmed if this takes 5-10 minutes and shows as though the screen is not responding.

title: All bookings showing as 'Internet Booking' in the Diary
text: It is possible to define a booking type to help identify different booking types within the diary. By default all bookings made online show as 'Internet Booking'. We can update the system so it inherits the booking type (Set under lookup items, Booking Types) (Example below) On the booking template, define the Booking Type: At this point you will need to contact the support team as we need to run a piece of code against the database to enable this functionality. Once done: When bookings are pulled through to the Diary the system will show the booking type under Details
description:
It is possible to define a booking type to help identify different booking types within the diary. 

By default all bookings made online show as 'Internet Booking'.


We can update the system so it inherits the booking type (Set under lookup items, Booking Types)


(Example below)


On the booking template, define the Booking Type:



At this point you will need to contact the support team as we need to run a piece of code against the database to enable this functionality. 


Once done:


When bookings are pulled through to the Diary the system will show the booking type under Details

title: How To Recreate Till Data In MStore Back Office
text: What does recreate till data do? In order to send updates that have been made in the Back Office and training tills, you will need to recreate till data, so these updates can be pushed down to the tills. How to recreate till data? From the Home or Setup screen, click Edit, in the top-left screen. Then Recreate Till Data. From this screen, you can then click Apply, to recreate till data for all till. If you want to only recreate till data for specific tills or departments, you will want to right-click on the tick next to All Departments, which will prevent all departments from updating. You can then right-click on the cross again the department you would like to recreate till data for, or click the plus to drill down into the sub-department and then again to the list of tills within that sub-department. Here, you can right-click on the cross next to the till to recreate till data for that till. Once you are happy with your selection and have clicked Apply, allow around thirty seconds for the recreate till data process to complete. At which point, you will get the below message appear. The final step in order the till to take this update is to log out of the till program, and then click Update System on the 4-button program. You may then log back into the Point Of Sale with the updates.
description:
What does recreate till data do?

In order to send updates that have been made in the Back Office and training tills, you will need to recreate till data, so these updates can be pushed down to the tills.


How to recreate till data?

From the Home or Setup screen, click Edit, in the top-left screen. Then Recreate Till Data.

 

From this screen, you can then click Apply, to recreate till data for all till. If you want to only recreate till data for specific tills or departments, you will want to right-click on the tick next to All Departments, which will prevent all departments from updating.


You can then right-click on the cross again the department you would like to recreate till data for, or click the plus to drill down into the sub-department and then again to the list of tills within that sub-department. Here, you can right-click on the cross next to the till to recreate till data for that till.



Once you are happy with your selection and have clicked Apply, allow around thirty seconds for the recreate till data process to complete. At which point, you will get the below message appear.



The final step in order the till to take this update is to log out of the till program, and then click Update System on the 4-button program. You may then log back into the Point Of Sale with the updates.

title: How to Copy Button Panels
text: Steps to copying a button panel are very simple. enter the button panels tab in the back office. Select in the drop down menu which panel is the on the you would like to copy. Then after this you can press the new button in the top left corner of the window and the current button panel you have selected will be copied. Then rename the panel and save it.
description:
Steps to copying a button panel are very simple. enter the button panels tab in the back office. 


Select in the drop down menu which panel is the on the you would like to copy. Then after this you can press the new button in the top left corner of the window and the current button panel you have selected will be copied. Then rename the panel and save it.

title: Error accessing documents in Mstore Back Office e.g. member letters
text: When trying to access member letters you get the following error In Back Office go to System Options On General Tab check the path in the documents location is correct. This will likely be a shared drive on the network, normally the server. Click on the 3 dots to the right of the path and check the correct location opens up. If file explorer opens up your local drive it is likely you do not have access to this shared network folder. Test this by copying the link and paste in If you cannot access this location or it returns an error similar to this, you will need to contact you IT department and get them to give you access to this folder.
description:
When trying to access member letters you get the following error



In Back Office go to System Options

On General Tab check the path in the documents location is correct.




This will likely be a shared drive on the network, normally the server.

Click on the 3 dots to the right of the path and check the correct location opens up.

If file explorer opens up your local drive it is likely you do not have access to this shared network folder.

Test this by copying the link and paste in 



If you cannot access this location or it returns an error similar to this, you will need to contact you IT department and get them to give you access to this folder.

title: Tablet - locked up screen is locked on Automatic Repair
text: Tablet used for stocktaking locks up with a blue screen and message 'Automatic repair' In this instance you may not be able to do anything, not even reboot / power off the device. Try connecting a usb keyboard to the device (you may need a USB - USB-c converter). Once connected to the tablet the keyboard will give the ability to scroll through the menus and reboot / continue to boot to windows.
description:
Tablet used for stocktaking locks up with a blue screen and message 'Automatic repair'


In this instance you may not be able to do anything, not even reboot / power off the device.


Try connecting a usb keyboard to the device (you may need a USB - USB-c converter).

Once connected to the tablet the keyboard will give the ability to scroll through the menus and reboot / continue to boot to windows.

title: Error with date when opening membership
text: If you get the below error message, it is down to the membership setup. The minimum join date allowed by the database is 01st Jan 1899 (this is a restriction within Microsoft Windows I believe), the max expiry date allowed by the system is 31 Dec 2099. Back office will only show Jan 01st 2000 to 31st Dec 2099. Within the membership setup, if you set it to anything over 200 years (200 years works as that is 1899) you will get this error. Solution: Set the membership duration to match the valid to and from date length. In this case 99 years.
description:
If you get the below error message, it is down to the membership setup.



The minimum join date allowed by the database is 01st Jan 1899 (this is a restriction within Microsoft Windows I believe), the max expiry date allowed by the system is 31 Dec 2099. 


Back office will only show Jan 01st 2000 to 31st Dec 2099. 


Within the membership setup, if you set it to anything over 200 years (200 years works as that is 1899) you will get this error. 



Solution: Set the membership duration to match the valid to and from date length. In this case 99 years.

title: Truncated Error
text: This error Is when one of the fields that a customer has filled out on a PLU or template for example is over the limit of characters used. The system will flag up the error below with the line "String or Binary data would be truncated" Example of the error
description:

title: Un-Cancel Non-Session Based Bookings
text: If you would like to Un-cancel an in-house non-session booking. You can do this by either double-clicking on the Cancelled text, or clicking File, Change Booking Status. This will prompt to confirm to Un-cancel this booking? You will not be able to perform this for online bookings, which can be done via this Knowledge Base article: Mark Online 'Unpaid Reservation' Bookings As Paid. If you are trying to un-cancel a booking and receive Cannot Un-Cancel message, please refer to this Knowledge Base article: Cannot Un-Cancel Session Based Booking.
description:
If you would like to Un-cancel an in-house non-session booking. You can do this by either double-clicking on the Cancelled text, or clicking File, Change Booking Status. This will prompt to confirm to Un-cancel this booking?





You will not be able to perform this for online bookings, which can be done via this Knowledge Base article: Mark Online 'Unpaid Reservation' Bookings As Paid.


If you are trying to un-cancel a booking and receive Cannot Un-Cancel message, please refer to this Knowledge Base article: 

Cannot Un-Cancel Session Based Booking.

title: 'File Not Found' Error When Attempting To Recreate Till Data
text: If you receive the below 'File not found' error when attempting to recreate till data; this is due to a till configuration file missing, so this file cannot be updated. To resolve this issue, please follow the below steps: Press the Windows key and the letter R at the same time, to open the Run window. Type in C:\ProgramData\Merac and press Enter. Copy the attached file MeracDat.txt file into the C:\ProgramData\Merac folder. Attempt to recreate till data again. This should then resolve the issue you are experiencing.
description:
If you receive the below 'File not found' error when attempting to recreate till data; this is due to a till configuration file missing, so this file cannot be updated.



To resolve this issue, please follow the below steps:

  1. Press the Windows key and the letter R at the same time, to open the Run window.
  2. Type in C:\ProgramData\Merac and press Enter.
  3. Copy the attached file MeracDat.txt file into the C:\ProgramData\Merac folder.
  4. Attempt to recreate till data again.


This should then resolve the issue you are experiencing.

title: Updating dashboard figures.
text: The below shows a dashboard that has not got the previous years figures in it to compare to the present day ones. This can happen when the forecasts from the previous years has not been updated. On this forecasts page you can update the forecasts and the figures will be grabbed from the database. If you change the year to the year before and then update the forecast. the table should then populate with the data.
description:
The below shows a dashboard that has not got the previous years figures in it to compare to the present day ones. This can happen when the forecasts from the previous years has not been updated. 





On this forecasts page you can update the forecasts and the figures will be grabbed from the database. If you change the year to the year before and then update the forecast. the table should then populate with the data.

title: Stock Adjustments are not deducting from the stock levels at the specified Stock Location
text: If you carry out a Stock Adjustment (via Setup > Stock > Stock Adjustments) and then someone checks the stock holding quantity of that stock item (for the specific 'Stock Location') and it did not change, it is most likely due to a setting on the relevant 'Stock Item'. Go into Setup > Stock > Stock Index and search for the relevant Stock Item in the usual way, then double click the stock item in question. This will show the 'Stock Maintenance' screen (see below example) for this 'Stock Item'. If stock movements are not being recorded for this 'Stock Item', it is likely that the tick box to the right of the text 'Track Qty:' is unticked. Click in the box so that it becomes ticked. The 'Save' button at the bottom of this screen can now be clicked to save the changes. This should now resolve the issue where the stock levels were not being deducted when a 'Stock Adjustment' was processed for this 'Stock Item'.
description:
If you carry out a Stock Adjustment (via Setup > Stock > Stock Adjustments) and then someone checks the stock holding quantity of that stock item (for the specific 'Stock Location') and it did not change, it is most likely due to a setting on the relevant 'Stock Item'. 


Go into Setup > Stock > Stock Index and search for the relevant Stock Item in the usual way, then double click the stock item in question. This will show the 'Stock Maintenance' screen (see below example) for this 'Stock Item'.



If stock movements are not being recorded for this 'Stock Item', it is likely that the tick box to the right of the text 'Track Qty:' is unticked. Click in the box so that it becomes ticked. The 'Save' button at the bottom of this screen can now be clicked to save the changes.


This should now resolve the issue where the stock levels were not being deducted when a 'Stock Adjustment' was processed for this 'Stock Item'.

title: Error transferring stock in Mstore BO
text: When attempting to transfer stock between location in Mstore BO you receive an error. You may get an error as above, or in some cases no error is displayed but BO locks up and drops out. One possible cause is that the unit type is not set o the left hand side despite being set on the stock details page. Set the unit and save, then try again to transfer the stock.
description:
When attempting to transfer stock between location in Mstore BO you receive an error.




You may get an error as above, or in some cases no error is displayed but BO locks up and drops out.

One possible cause is that the unit type is not set o the left hand side despite being set on the stock details page.

Set the unit and save, then try again to transfer the stock.

title: Editing Booking Confirmation Letter For Back Office Bookings
text: If you would like to edit the booking confirmation letter sent out from the Back Office Booking screen, you will need to: Open any booking from the Back Office, Click Edit and Edit Mailmerge Template. This will open a Windows File Explorer window directed at the default booking confirmation letter template folder for MStore. You will then need to find the booking confirmation letter template on your network, that you would like to amend, and click Open. A Microsoft Word document will open, but may not show on your screen, so you will need to select the Microsoft Word icon on your taskbar, for the window to appear in front. With the Back Office booking confirmation letter open, you will be able to amend this document, and Insert Merge Field from MStore from the Microsoft Word Mailings tab along the ribbon on the top. Once you are happy with your changes, save the document, and then you can reference this document by clicking ... next to Letter: (as you can see below).
description:
If you would like to edit the booking confirmation letter sent out from the Back Office Booking screen, you will need to:


  1. Open any booking from the Back Office, Click Edit and Edit Mailmerge Template.


  2. This will open a Windows File Explorer window directed at the default booking confirmation letter template folder for MStore. You will then need to find the booking confirmation letter template on your network, that you would like to amend, and click Open.

  3. A Microsoft Word document will open, but may not show on your screen, so you will need to select the Microsoft Word icon on your taskbar, for the window to appear in front.

  4. With the Back Office booking confirmation letter open, you will be able to amend this document, and Insert Merge Field from MStore from the Microsoft Word Mailings tab along the ribbon on the top.

  5. Once you are happy with your changes, save the document, and then you can reference this document by clicking ... next to Letter: (as you can see below).

title: Unable to move a booking in Mstore.
text: You get an error trying to move a booking in Mstore. This may be due to the use of the default calendar 'Whole Year' Create a new calendar or use an existing one e.g opening times. Then try and move the booking again.
description:
You get an error trying to move a booking in Mstore.


This may be due to the use of the default calendar 'Whole Year'

Create a new calendar or use an existing one e.g opening times.



Then try and move the booking again.

title: Mstore Diary not displaying correct date
text: Back office calendar not displaying correctly It's not possible to browse the calendar on the Merac back-office - selecting 'Today' doesn't work, and is defaulting to January 2024. It's not possible to change the month in the drop-down, and the right arrow doesn't work either. The drop-down on the year works, but the month is still static and set to January. E.G Usually this is due to an incorrect date and time format. In this case set to USA. To resolve go to control panel - language - and change to UK date and time format. Please be aware that this may be a slightly different process in your version of windows.
description:
• Back office calendar not displaying correctly


It's not possible to browse the calendar on the Merac back-office - selecting 'Today' doesn't work, and is defaulting to January 2024.  

It's not possible to change the month in the drop-down, and the right arrow doesn't work either.  

The drop-down on the year works, but the month is still static and set to January.  

E.G


Usually this is due to an incorrect date and time format.

In this case set to USA.


To resolve go to control panel - language - and change to UK date and time format.


Please be aware that this may be a slightly different process in your version of windows.

title: Moving a session booking time but not the date.
text: Inability to change a session booking time when not changing the date. Unable to move the booking to a different time on the same day. e.g. Our Father Christmas train have multiple sessions on one day. If we want to move a booking from one DAY to another DAY then the 'Move booking' button works fine. But if we want to change the time but not the date of the booking this function does not work. The change seats button only works within one session, so this is no use either. How do we move seats from one session to another on the same date? Solution There is no button to move a (session) booking time. First find and open the booking and take screenshots of the current booking / allocated seats etc as is so you have a record of it to go back to (in case they need to refer to how it was). Then would need to first add the tickets for the relevant session for the new time at the required quantities to the existing booking (ensuring you check the prices of the new tickets added) and re-allocate the seats. Caveat, this will only be allowed if there are the tickets / seats available for the new time. Check these additions are correct, then I would save the changes at that point. They would then remove the tickets at the times they did not want - I believe it would be best to de-allocate seats before removing the tickets to ensure the seats are put back into availability in case just removing the tickets does not de-allocate the seats (old versions had issues with releasing seat availability this way it should negate that). Then check the booking looks as required and save the changes.
description:
Inability to change a session booking time when not changing the date.

Unable to move the booking to a different time on the same day.


e.g.

Our Father Christmas train have multiple sessions on one day.  
If we want to move a booking from one DAY to another DAY then the 'Move booking' button works fine.
But if we want to change the time but not the date of the booking this function does not work.
The change seats button only works within one session, so this is no use either.
How do we move seats from one session to another on the same date?


Solution

There is no button to move a (session) booking time. 
First find and open the booking and take screenshots of the current booking / allocated seats etc as is so you have a record of it to go back to (in case they need to refer to how it was). 
Then would need to first add the tickets for the relevant session for the new time at the required quantities to the existing booking (ensuring you check the prices of the new tickets added) and re-allocate the seats. 
Caveat, this will only be allowed if there are the tickets / seats available for the new time. 
Check these additions are correct, then I would save the changes at that point. 
They would then remove the tickets at the times they did not want - I believe it would be best to de-allocate seats before removing the tickets to ensure the seats are put back into availability in case just removing the tickets does not de-allocate the seats (old versions had issues with releasing seat availability this way it should negate that). 
Then check the booking looks as required and save the changes.

title: Promotions not working on some Mstore tills.
text: Issue: Promotions not working on some Mstore tills. First and obvious thing to check would be that till data has been re created There is also an issue where if the Language setting on the PC is set to US rather than UK this may cause an issue. This was particularly noticeable on Windows 11 installation. Installing the UK language pack and setting the PC to use UK resolved the issue. Confirmation from a customer below; I can now confirm that it was the date format. On the other till I changed the date format only and promotions started working. I suspect PMStore grabs the local date as a string and uses it to compare with the start/end date. As the format was different than expected, the date fell out of range which made the promotion invalid. I changed the region and language settings just in case we had another Winddows update defaulting regional settings.
description:
Issue: Promotions not working on some Mstore tills.


First and obvious thing to check would be that till data has been re created


There is also an issue where if the Language setting on the PC is set to US rather than UK this may cause an issue.


This was particularly noticeable on Windows 11 installation.

Installing the UK language pack and setting the PC to use UK resolved the issue.


Confirmation from a customer below;


I can now confirm that it was the date format. 

On the other till I changed the date format only and promotions started working.
I suspect PMStore grabs the local date as a string and uses it to compare with the start/end date. As the format was different than expected, the date fell out of range which made the promotion invalid.

I changed the region and  language settings just in case we had another Winddows update defaulting regional settings.

title: Unable to Move Booking.
text: Trying to Move a booking to a different day you get an error similar to the one below. One possible reason is the default calendar has been used. Try Changing creating a new Calendar with the dates required, in this case Opening Times. Apply and close and then try to move the booking again.
description:
Trying to Move a booking to a different day you get an error similar to the one below.




One possible reason is the default calendar has been used.



Try Changing creating a new Calendar with the dates required, in this case Opening Times.



Apply and close and then try to move the booking again.

title: Deal price promotion in Mstore
text: How to create a deal in Mstore e.g. Meal deal. where a set of items cost a certain amount when bought together. An example might be a sandwich, a drink and snack bought together for a single price. Start by Selecting the deal price in promotions Set the group price and select the number of items from each group require to meet the promotion requirements. Apply to create the promotion the in Details select the individual items that are in each group as below.
description:
How to create a deal in Mstore e.g. Meal deal. 

where a set of items cost a certain amount when bought together.

An example might be a sandwich, a drink and snack bought together for a single price.


Start by Selecting the deal price in promotions

Set the group price and select the number of items from each group require to meet the promotion requirements.

 




Apply to create the promotion the in Details select the individual items that are in each group as below.

title: Member Mailing
text: TABLE OF CONTENTS Introduction Using Member Mailing Introduction The following is a step by step example on how to use the ‘Member Mailing’ option within the ‘K3|mstore’ back office software. This option enables you to create your own data extracts from your member’s database which you can either (i) extract as a Microsoft Excel spread sheet, or (ii) mail merge to Microsoft Word. Using both functions requires you to have Microsoft Word and Excel already installed on your computer by your IT department. Please note that K3 Business Technologies (K3 BTG) can only support any problems experienced during the creation of the data extract in the ‘K3|mstore’. Once the data has been extracted into a Microsoft Excel spreadsheet, or merged into Microsoft Word, then any technical support or training for these applications is not provided by K3 BTG. Using Member Mailing The following instructions detail how to use member mailing to extract data. First, click on the ‘Members’ button. Next, select the ‘Mailing’ option. Select ‘Mail_Membership’ from the dropdown list. Now click on ‘Accept’. You will see the screen as shown below. We will now show you one specific example of how to extract member data, for memberships will expire between a selected date range. Select ‘Membership expiry date’ from the ‘Database Field’ dropdown as shown below. Now select 'Is between the values' from the ‘Comparison’ dropdown as shown below. Now select the required “from” date from the top ‘Value’ dropdown as shown below. Now select the required “to” date from the bottom ‘Value’ dropdown as shown below. Next click on the 'Accept' button. N.B. in this example we are only carrying out a simple search. If you wanted to add multiple ‘Search Criteria’ you could select other criteria from the ‘Database Field’ dropdown list here and add these additional criteria as required (using a similar procedure as detailed above). Once all the search criteria have been defined as required, click on ‘Extract’. If you want the results as a Microsoft Excel spreadsheet, click on 'Export Data To List'. The Microsoft Excel spreadsheet will be created automatically. Now click on the ‘Microsoft Excel’ icon on your Windows ‘Taskbar’ . This will open this spreadsheet so you can view and use this data as required. Alternatively, the results can be merged to a Microsoft Word mail merge template. First ensure you have selected the required Microsoft Word mail merge template. To do this click here to navigate to the required Microsoft Word mail merge template. Navigate to the required folder and click on the required Microsoft Word mail merge template. Next click on ‘Open’. Now click on the ‘Mail Merge’ to Word button. The mail merge will be created automatically. Click the ‘Microsoft Word’ icon on your Windows ‘taskbar’ to view the mail merge results. As explained previously K3 BTG do not provide support or training on Microsoft Word, but we have included some simple notes below on using the mail merge facilities in Microsoft Word. If the screens appear different when using mail merges on your version of Word, then please speak to your preferred IT training provider for advice. Please note that there is an issue with most versions of Microsoft Word when using mail merges whereby the toolbars at the top of the screen will not work unless you first minimise then maximise this window. Please minimise then maximise this window before proceeding. Once you have done this, click on the ‘Preview Results’ icon. This will show you what the merge results would look like if completed. Next click on ‘Finish and Merge’ to proceed with the mail merge. There are now three options that can be selected as shown here. These are detailed below. The options available in this dropdown menu are shown below. Each of these options is explained on the following pages. (1) ‘Edit Individual Documents’ Under the ‘Merge records’ section, select which record(s) you want to include: Select ‘All’ to edit all records. There are now three options that can be selected, which are detailed below. To edit only the record displayed select ‘Current record’. To edit only certain records, type a range in the text boxes. Next click on ‘OK’ to merge the required records into a Microsoft Word document. (2) ‘Print Documents’ Under the ‘Merge records’ section, select which record(s) you want to include: Select ‘All’ to print all records. To print only the record displayed select ‘Current record’. To print only certain records, type a range in the text boxes. Now click ‘OK’, which takes you to the printer selection screen. Now select the required printer. Click ‘OK’ to print all the merged letters. (3) ‘Send Email Messages’ In the ‘Subject line:’ text box, type a subject. From the ‘Mail format’ dropdown list, select the desired format for your message. Under the ‘Send records’ section, select which record(s) you want to include: Select ‘All’ to send email to all of your records. To send email for only the record displayed select ‘Current record’. To send email to only certain records, type a range in the text boxes. Caution: if you now click on ‘OK’ the email messages will be sent to your recipient(s).
description:
TABLE OF CONTENTS

  • Introduction
  • Using Member Mailing



Introduction

 


The following is a step by step example on how to use the ‘Member Mailing’ option within the ‘K3|mstore’ back office software. This option enables you to create your own data extracts from your member’s database which you can either (i) extract as a Microsoft Excel spread sheet, or (ii) mail merge to Microsoft Word.

 

Using both functions requires you to have Microsoft Word and Excel already installed on your computer by your IT department.  Please note that K3 Business Technologies (K3 BTG) can only support any problems experienced during the creation of the data extract in the ‘K3|mstore’.

 

Once the data has been extracted into a Microsoft Excel spreadsheet, or merged into Microsoft Word, then any technical support or training for these applications is not provided by K3 BTG.

 


Using Member Mailing

 

 

The following instructions detail how to use member mailing to extract data.

 

First, click on the ‘Members’ button.

 

 

 

 

Next, select the ‘Mailing’ option.

 

 

 

Select ‘Mail_Membership’ from the dropdown list.

 

 

 

Now click on ‘Accept’.

 


You will see the screen as shown below.

 

 


 

We will now show you one specific example of how to extract member data, for memberships will expire between a selected date range.

 

Select ‘Membership expiry date’ from the ‘Database Field’ dropdown as shown below.

 

 

 

Now select 'Is between the values' from the ‘Comparison’ dropdown as shown below.

 


 

Now select the required “from” date from the top ‘Value’ dropdown as shown below.

 

 

Now select the required “to” date from the bottom ‘Value’ dropdown as shown below.

 

 

Next click on the 'Accept' button.

 

 

N.B. in this example we are only carrying out a simple search. If you wanted to add multiple ‘Search Criteria’ you could select other criteria from the ‘Database Field’ dropdown list here and add these additional criteria as required (using a similar procedure as detailed above).

 

 

 

Once all the search criteria have been defined as required, click on ‘Extract’.

 

If you want the results as a Microsoft Excel spreadsheet, click on 'Export Data To List'.

 

 

The Microsoft Excel spreadsheet will be created automatically.

 


 

Now click on the ‘Microsoft Excel’ icon on your Windows ‘Taskbar’  .

 

This will open this spreadsheet so you can view and use this data as required.

 

Alternatively, the results can be merged to a Microsoft Word mail merge template.

 

First ensure you have selected the required Microsoft Word mail merge template.

 

To do this click here to navigate to the required Microsoft Word mail merge template.

 

 

Navigate to the required folder and click on the required Microsoft Word mail merge template.

 

 

Next click on ‘Open’. 

 

Now click on the ‘Mail Merge’ to Word button.


 

 

The mail merge will be created automatically.

Click the ‘Microsoft Word’ icon on your Windows ‘taskbar’  to view the mail merge results.

 

As explained previously K3 BTG do not provide support or training on Microsoft Word, but we have included some simple notes below on using the mail merge facilities in Microsoft Word. 

 

If the screens appear different when using mail merges on your version of Word, then please speak to your preferred IT training provider for advice.

 

Please note that there is an issue with most versions of Microsoft Word when using mail merges whereby the toolbars at the top of the screen will not work unless you first minimise then maximise this window. Please minimise then maximise this window before proceeding.

 

 

 

Once you have done this, click on the ‘Preview Results’ icon.

 

This will show you what the merge results would look like if completed.

 


 

Next click on ‘Finish and Merge’ to proceed with the mail merge.

 

 

 

There are now three options that can be selected as shown here. These are detailed below.

 

 

 

The options available in this dropdown menu are shown below.

 

 

Each of these options is explained on the following pages.

 


(1) ‘Edit Individual Documents’

 

 

Under the ‘Merge records’ section, select which record(s) you want to include:

 

Select ‘All’ to edit all records.

 

There are now three options that can be selected, which are detailed below.

 

To edit only the record displayed select ‘Current record’. 

 

To edit only certain records, type a range in the text boxes.

 

Next click on ‘OK’ to merge the required records into a Microsoft Word document.

 

 

(2) ‘Print Documents’

 


 

Under the ‘Merge records’ section, select which record(s) you want to include:

 

Select ‘All’ to print all records.

 

To print only the record displayed select ‘Current record’. 

 

To print only certain records, type a range in the text boxes.

 

Now click ‘OK’, which takes you to the printer selection screen.


Now select the required printer.

 

 

Click ‘OK’ to print all the merged letters.                                                                                         

 

 

(3) ‘Send Email Messages’

 

In the ‘Subject line:’ text box, type a subject.

 

From the ‘Mail format’ dropdown list, select the desired format for your message.

 

Under the ‘Send records’ section, select which record(s) you want to include:

 

Select ‘All’ to send email to all of your records.

 

To send email for only the record displayed select ‘Current record’. 

 

To send email to only certain records, type a range in the text boxes.

 

 

 

                               
 

 

Caution: if you now click on ‘OK’ the email messages will be sent to your recipient(s).

title: Cannot Un-Cancel Session Based Booking
text: If you have followed the Un-Cancel Non-Session Bookings Knowledge Base article, but are receiving the below error message, this is because you are trying to un-cancel a session based booking. Sessions have strict availability, and when cancelling this booking, the availability on that booking gets released, so that this can be booked by another customer. Therefore, you cannot re-allocate the session availability, as this could cause double-booking seats and overbooking on the session that would since have further bookings on it.
description:
If you have followed the Un-Cancel Non-Session Bookings Knowledge Base article, but are receiving the below error message, this is because you are trying to un-cancel a session based booking. 



Sessions have strict availability, and when cancelling this booking, the availability on that booking gets released, so that this can be booked by another customer. Therefore, you cannot re-allocate the session availability, as this could cause double-booking seats and overbooking on the session that would since have further bookings on it.

title: Applying discount via back office (Account Promotion)
text: It is possible to discount bookings in back office by using an account promotion. Account promotions need to be applied to the customer account, and this will then automatically apply the membership promotion. This is generally used for repeat customers / group bookings. Within the promotions screen, set up a new promotion and apply this to whichever items qualify: (Screenshot below from test system) The promotion then needs to be applied to any customer accounts that you would like it to qualify for: Before searching for the customer: Link it to the customer:
description:
It is possible to discount bookings in back office by using an account promotion. 


Account promotions need to be applied to the customer account, and this will then automatically apply the membership promotion. This is generally used for repeat customers / group bookings. 


Within the promotions screen, set up a new promotion and apply this to whichever items qualify:

(Screenshot below from test system)



The promotion then needs to be applied to any customer accounts that you would like it to qualify for:



Before searching for the customer:


Link it to the customer:

title: Booking Templates Breakdown - Template Styles
text: Breakdown of each template style: Tickets: Tickets is generally used when you don't need to worry about availability and just want to sell tickets. Open dated will just give the option to sell as many tickets as you set available under each bookable resource. In most cases this can be set to 9999 and will just give unlimited availability. Setting to 10 on the bookable resource will limit how many tickets are available PER BOOKING, but this will not stop people from just making another booking. Date specified: Setting to date specified means the tickets are then only valid for one day, but using the ticket template style will not limit availability (aside the number per booking): Availability / Groups: Availability / Groups does take into account availability PER TIME SLOT. Generally this will be per day, but it is possible to have more than one time slot per day. Sold 6, refreshing the page: Once availability for the day is gone, the day will go red and no longer be bookable. Birthday Parties: Requires specialized set up. Session / Tours: This type of template is determined by the number of tickets allowed per session: (Set to 20 for testing)
description:
Breakdown of each template style:


Tickets:


Tickets is generally used when you don't need to worry about availability and just want to sell tickets. 


Open dated will just give the option to sell as many tickets as you set available under each bookable resource. In most cases this can be set to 9999 and will just give unlimited availability. 



Setting to 10 on the bookable resource will limit how many tickets are available PER BOOKING, but this will not stop people from just making another booking. 



Date specified:



Setting to date specified means the tickets are then only valid for one day, but using the ticket template style will not limit availability (aside the number per booking):



Availability / Groups:


Availability / Groups does take into account availability PER TIME SLOT. Generally this will be per day, but it is possible to have more than one time slot per day. 




Sold 6, refreshing the page: 


Once availability for the day is gone, the day will go red and no longer be bookable. 


Birthday Parties:


Requires specialized set up. 


Session / Tours: 


This type of template is determined by the number of tickets allowed per session:

(Set to 20 for testing)

title: "Page Header plus Page Footer is too large for the page" Error When Trying To Screen/Print Report
text: Issue You are getting the below error "Page Header plus Page Footer is too large for the page" when trying to screen or print a report within MStore Back Office. This is due to your default Windows printer default page size is smaller than A4, which is what the report has been designed to fit on. This generally happens on tills with receipt and ticket printers. Solution Please go to this Microsoft support page to set your default printer to an A4 printer: https://support.microsoft.com/en-gb/windows/set-a-default-printer-in-windows-e10cf8b8-e596-b102-bf84-c41022b5036f#id0ebf=windows_11. If you do not have a physical A4 printer connected to your PC, use a virtual printer (Microsoft Print to PDF or Microsoft XPS Document Writer) that are generally installed on all Windows PC's.
description:
Issue

You are getting the below error "Page Header plus Page Footer is too large for the page" when trying to screen or print a report within MStore Back Office. This is due to your default Windows printer default page size is smaller than A4, which is what the report has been designed to fit on. This generally happens on tills with receipt and ticket printers.



Solution

Please go to this Microsoft support page to set your default printer to an A4 printer: https://support.microsoft.com/en-gb/windows/set-a-default-printer-in-windows-e10cf8b8-e596-b102-bf84-c41022b5036f#id0ebf=windows_11.


 If you do not have a physical A4 printer connected to your PC, use a virtual printer (Microsoft Print to PDF or Microsoft XPS Document Writer) that are generally installed on all Windows PC's.

title: Can You Update Multiple POS Button Layouts Before Recreating Till Data?
text: Within MStore 3.15+, you can make multiple amendments to different Button layouts before recreate till data, without losing any changes, to push all the button amendments to all the tills using different Button layouts at the same time. The only caveat of this would be if you recreate till data on a till before this tills has been updated with these amendments, where all other changes will be lost.
description:
Within MStore 3.15+, you can make multiple amendments to different Button layouts before recreate till data, without losing any changes, to push all the button amendments to all the tills using different Button layouts at the same time.


The only caveat of this would be if you recreate till data on a till before this tills has been updated with these amendments, where all other changes will be lost.
